comments:
I often get the following exception when running Eclipse 3.2 on Redhat Fedore Core 3 through NX (http://www.nomachine.com). No visible loss of functionality, though. IBM Java 5.0SR2.

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 0 2006-07-07 10:42:11.539
!MESSAGE java.lang.NullPointerException
!STACK 0
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.swt.dnd.ClipboardProxy.getFunc(ClipboardProxy.java:115)

Does this only happen to you when you are running through NX? 
Looks like the clipboard content is not getting set, but I cannot reproduce this locally.
Do you have a simple test case that reproduces the problem for you, or at least a description of what you were doing when the NPE occured? Even knowing which widgets you were copying from and pasting to might be helpful.
This only happens in NX. I will run it in debugger next week and will try to provide more info.

This problem happens in Java and Text editor. The following sequence of steps seems to work most of the times

* Open java class in Java editor and position cursor at begining of "package ...;" line
* Press and hold Shift key
* Quickly press RightArray key few times (this selects some text)
* Immediately release Shift key

I get NPE every two or three times I try steps above.

I spent some time debugging this and it looks like ClipboardProxy.setData sometimes results in "nested" call to ClipboardProxy.clearFunc which nulls primaryClipboardDataTypes. Here is relevant stack trace which I got by instrumenting clearFunc with "new Exception().printStackTrace()"

	at org.eclipse.swt.dnd.ClipboardProxy.clearFunc(ClipboardProxy.java:83)
	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.gtk.OS._gtk_clipboard_set_with_data(Native Method)
	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.gtk.OS.gtk_clipboard_set_with_data(OS.java:3805)
	at org.eclipse.swt.dnd.ClipboardProxy.setData(ClipboardProxy.java:177)
	at org.eclipse.swt.dnd.Clipboard.setContents(Clipboard.java:447)
	at org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.setClipboardContent(StyledText.java:6689)
	at org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.handleKeyUp(StyledText.java:5062)
	at org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText$7.handleEvent(StyledText.java:4790)


Hope this helps.

This doesn't look recursive to men (but might be).  KB and SN to investigate further by determining the callbacks in a non-failure case and seeing whether the case that Igor is seeing is different.
